column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Do
#Text=I think it would be a good idea to impeach him ?
#Text=I think it would be a terrible idea to impeach him .

#Text=Among other reasons , I think it would have the effect of placing disproportionate responsibility on to him when a lot of the blame for the violations I ’m talking about rests in the hands of Congress .
#Text=Congress did not have to vote for the Patriot Act , as they did almost unanimously in the Senate .
#Text=Congress did not have to expand his domestic wire-tapping power this summer , even beyond what he was initially doing in his secret program .
#Text=Congress did not have to roll over and play dead with respect to torture and rendition and Guantanamo and all the other human rights disasters .
#Text=They really bear a lot of responsibility and we should not be letting them off the hook .
#Text=By going after Bush , it deflects responsibility from Congress , it deflects responsibility from the courts , which have been issuing a lot of bad decisions , I think .
#Text=It also deflects responsibility from the Democrats .
#Text=It makes it too much of a partisan issue .
#Text=There is bipartisan responsibility here .
#Text=For that reason I strongly oppose it .
#Text=I ’m not speaking for the ACLU , I know some people in the ACLU would like to see it .
#Text=DS : You just do n’t think it would be productive .
#Text=NS :
#Text=I do n’t think it would advance civil liberties .
#Text=Gun rights
#Text=DS : Where do you stand on the Second Amendment and the rights of gun owners ?
#Text=Are the rights accorded to well-armed militias , or is it accorded to unfettered rights of individuals to own guns ?
#Text=NS :

#Text=I actually do n’t think in reality that the difference is that profound , because when you look at the big debate , and you stated it well , does the government protect the individual right to bear arms , does it only protect a collective right through the state militias ?
#Text=Let ’s assume for the sake of argument it does protect an individual right , it is no more absolute than freedom of speech or any other right in the Constitution .

#Text=No right is absolute ; the government is always allowed to restrict the right if it can satisfy Constitutional strict scrutiny and show the restriction is narrowly tailored to promote a goal of compelling importance .

#Text=Ironically , the very first federal appellate court in recent history to hold that there was an individual right to bear arms under the Second Amendment , the Fifth Circuit , then went on to nevertheless uphold the particular restriction that was being challenged ! Mainly , that the guy was under a restraining order for domestic abuse and he was n’t allowed to possess a gun .
#Text=The court said the Second Amendment protects your right , but this regulation does n’t violate your right .
#Text=So I do n’t think it makes a big difference .

#Text=And conversely , to say it ’s not an individual right does n’t mean that gun owners are without all rights , and the ACLU has often collaborated with gun owners rights organizations to defend their rights to privacy , to defend their rights to due process ; in other words , they do n’t forfeit all of their Constitutional rights just because they are gun owners , even if the Second Amendment does n’t protect .
#Text=So I think it ’s more a philosophical debate than it has any practical difference .
